string.value: When you ask Dr.#p1032104# about the book, she says that she sent it to her professor who really needed it. Go to #b#m102000000#'s East Rock Mountain#k to find #b#p1022006##k, Dr.#p1032104#'s professor.
You met #p1022006# at the East Rocky Mountain.
Is there something I can do for you? Hm? #p1012110# sent you? Has my kid done something bad? Oh, then what brings you here? A book? Oh, you mean #t4161050#, correct?

I sent it to my scholarly master who is conducting research on fossils. He's been trying to idenitify a fossil he recently discovered and thought it might be a Dragon fossil. If you want the book, please visit my master.
My master is a renowned scholar in fossilology. His name is Dr. #b#p1022006##k. He is always roaming outside. He should be near the #bEast Rocky Mountain in #m102000000##k right about now.

That's one unique creature you've got there. It looks like a lizard but looking at its bone structure, it's obvious that it isn't a lizard. Could I just... Oh, I'm sorry. I got carried away. Anyway, good luck.
I thought you needed that book. I guess not.
Whoa! Wha... What is that? What is that strange creature? A lizard? I don't care if it's a lizard or a salamander! Get it out of here. It's gross! Just tell me why you are here!
A book? Oh, maybe you're talking about the book I have. Wait here for a minute.
I guess you haven't met my master yet. My master, Dr. #b#p1022006#, is at the #kEast Rocky Mountain in #b#m102000000##k.
